definition: (of a watch or clock) to keep time/(physics) propagation time/travel time (of a wave)
to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)
surname Shi
old variant of 時|时[shi2]
o'clock/time/when/hour/season/period

sentences.english: Li Zhongming would burn up those drawings, he left home leave Yang Nian letters.
sentences.chinese: 黎仲明将那些图纸烧毁，他临走时给杨念留下书信。

sentences.english: A close up of the sundial which is very accurate, by the way.
sentences.chinese: 日晷的近景，它走时非常精确。

sentences.english: I finally picked out three books which were written in a style easy enough for me to understand, and I took these back to my room.
sentences.chinese: 临走时，我还选了三本简单易懂的带回寝室。

sentences.english: He had said to finish the tutor to Gao Luo, come back in the evening.
sentences.chinese: 他临走时说做完家教要找高洛去，晚上回来。

sentences.english: As I was walking along the path, several small animals started from the bushes.
sentences.chinese: 当我沿着小径走时，几只小动物从灌林丛中窜了出来。

sentences.english: When we flew away the bear was still there and was watching us with sad eyes.
sentences.chinese: 我们飞走时熊仍在那儿，忧愁地注视着我们。

sentences.english: The guests were given a tiny jar of honey from the White House beehives to take home.
sentences.chinese: 每位客人临走时还被赠送了一小瓶白宫自产的蜂蜜。

sentences.english: When I in the street , there many people The taxies .
sentences.chinese: 当我在街上走时，总有许多人在等出租车。

sentences.english: When he left he cut short the father's nervous thanks gruffly.
sentences.chinese: 临走时，他很粗鲁地打断了那父亲的紧张的道谢的话。

sentences.english: And he told me I could go to the canteen to get paste, he had arranged well with the kitchen.
sentences.chinese: 临走时说，糨子到伙房去打，他已经跟炊事员说好了。

sentences.english: When he left, liu town told him, when he and his friendship to the end.
sentences.chinese: 临走时，柳时镇告诉他，自己和他的友情到此结束。
临走时，我的印象很深刻。

sentences.english: There is a being who carried off my sky when she went away.
sentences.chinese: 有个人临走时把天带走了。

sentences.english: It is not only of immense size, but is extremely accurated as well.
sentences.chinese: 此钟不仅外型巨大，而且走时也非常准确。

sentences.english: I felt despondent as I went back to the house, and I told Carrie I thought the party was a failure.
sentences.chinese: 我往回走时感到很沮丧，对卡丽说我觉得聚会很失败。

definition: before leaving/on departure
to turn round/to turn one's head/later/by and by
on leaving/on the point of departure
(of the sun) to set
to tell/to exhort/injunction
to turn back/to retrace one's steps
to leave/to exit
to overtake/to catch up with/to hurry/to rush/to try to catch (the bus etc)/to drive (cattle etc) forward/to drive (sb) away/to avail oneself of (an opportunity)/until
to return/to go back
to get up/to leave/to set forth
to warn repeatedly/to urge/to exhort again and again
(of a person) to turn round/to face about/(of a widow) to remarry (archaic)
to stop/to bar the way
to go out/to leave home/to go on a journey/away from home/(of a woman) to get married
to get on or into (a bus, train, car etc)
to go upstairs
